title: Looking for light squarish slab serifs
content: I am looking for a thin slab serif that has a bit of a contemporary or "tech" like feel without being cheesy. I have looked at [Apex Serif](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820161539/http:/vllg.com/Constellation/Apex_Serif#panel=usage-poster), [Gingar](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820161539/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mellediete/gingar/), [Soho](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820161539/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/soho/), and [Vitesse.](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820161539/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/font_overview.php?productLineID=100036) These are all pretty close to what I want, but I am wondering what else is out there. Any ideas of other fonts in a similar vein?
author: cumaso

comments.content:
Recent releases:

Quadon  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/rene-bieder/quadon/](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820161539/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/rene-bieder/quadon/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/rene-bieder/quadon/")

Alianza  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/corradine/alianza/](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820161539/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/corradine/alianza/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/corradine/alianza/")

Tabac Slab  
 [http://suitcasetype.com/tabac-slab/specimen](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820161539/http:/suitcasetype.com/tabac-slab/specimen "http://suitcasetype.com/tabac-slab/specimen")
